page.title: 11Community College:Chatteris
page.content: Built in 1938 the school, a comprehensive taking over 600 pupils of all abilities aged 11-16, has a large catchment area. Pupils come from primary schools at Benwick, Manea, Doddington, Wimblington and the King Edward School in Chatteris. A large number of pupils have to be taken to and from the school by buses. The school previously operated a transfer system at 13 to the Neale Wade School in March. Since September, 1983 the system has been reorganised and the transfer no longer takes place. Pupils can work towards a full range of CSE and GCE subjects in their final year. For further qualifications they must travel to March or Wisbech. The facilities for craft and science have been extended and there is a new sports hall which is also used by the public.
